title: Hikaru Nakamura | The Winner of Paris #GrandChessTour
description:
#agadmator he 2018 Paris GCT tournament is again facilitated by generous contributions from Colliers International, Vivendi, Canal+ and DailyMotion. The tournament is the second stop on the 2018 Grand Chess Tour and will see the participants competing over 9 rounds of rapid chess and 18 rounds of blitz chess for a total prize fund of $150,000!

Viswanathan Anand vs Hikaru Nakamura
Grand Chess Tour Paris (Blitz) (2018), Paris FRA, rd 11, Jun-24 
Pirc Defense: Classical Variation. Quiet System Chigorin Line (B08)

1. e4 d6 2. d4 g6 3. Nc3 Bg7 4. Nf3 Nf6 5. Be2 O-O 6. O-O Nc6 7. d5 Nb8 8. Re1 c6 9. h3 b6 10. Bf4 Bb7 11. Qd2 Nbd7 12. a4 a6 13. dc6 Bc6 14. Bd3 e5 15. Bh6 Nc5 16. Bg7 Kg7 17. b4 Nd3 18. cd3 Re8 19. d4 Bb7 20. d5 Rc8 21. Qe3 Rc4 22. b5 Qc7 23. Rac1 Rc8 24. ba6 Ba6 25. Na2 Ne4 26. Rc4 Qc4 27. Ne5 de5 28. Qe4 Qa2 29. Qe5 Kg8 30. Qd4 Qc4 31. Qb6 Qa4 32. d6 Bb5 33. Qb7 Rf8 34. Rc1 Bd7 35. Qd5 Qf4 36. Rc7 Be6

DATES June 20-24, 2018
LOCATION Groupe Canal+, 5 Boulevard de la République, 92100 Boulogne Billancourt
FORMAT 10-Player Round Robin
COMMENTATORS 
English – GM Yasser Seirawan, IM Jovanka Houska, GM Alejandro Ramirez, GM Maurice Ashley and GM Romain Edouard 

Russian – GM Evgenij Miroshnichenko and GM Yaroslav Zherebukh 

French – Astrid Bard (Canal+ Anchor), IM Jean-Baptist Mullon, GM Yannick Pelletier and IM Almira Skripchenko 

PRIZE FUND $150,000
